result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Daryl Rane Berendes in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Daryl Rane Berendes.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Recess for signed plea form.  Case recalled at 1:45 p.m.  Parties stipulate to finding of NGI by Dr. Seipel and there is not an agreement as to the Conditional Release and there is a Conditional Release Plan in the Milwaukee Co. case.  Atty. Ertl states competency was previously raised and defendant currently receiving treatment and no issue on competency at this time.  No contest plea entered to Count 1 and Count 2.  Court accepts the plea to Count 1 and Count 2 and Court adopts the finding of NGI on Count 1 and Count 2 and Dismisses for read-in Count 3, Count 4, Count 5 and Count 6.  Court orders Predisposition report and commits the defendant to the Department of Health Services for a term that will be determined at the next hearing and commitment to commence immediately.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daryl Rane Berendes in court, in custody. (Milwaukee Co. 21CM3066; 21CF4346; Monroe Co. 21CF628)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  SPD office informed Atty. Christopher Ertl will be appointed to this case.  State uncomfortable with making bond argument due to no attorney being present.  Court orders $25,000.00 cash bond. Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Defendant states an NGI plea was supported in Milwaukee Co. 21CF4346.  Court finds the NGI plea was not supported.  State to prepare an order to produce.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
